metadata.title: CVE-2021-38491 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mixed-content checks were unable to analyze opaque origins which led tosome mixed content being loaded. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 92.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
